data.text: @milesSI At the moment I know more people with Covid than ever before.  Symptoms for everyone are mild, so vaccinations are working, but it is still lots of it out there.

@milesSI hospital admission numbers are not a good data point for severity anymore. In Dec UMC Groningen were saying about 30% of their covid (delta) admission numbers were for patients admitted for something else, then tested positive. Omicron has moved that balance even further

@milesSI The background levels of c-19 in UK must be significantly higher. The UK govt has done as much as possible to stop ppl getting tested. I suspect the hospitalisation NOs are incidental due to high background levels similar to Denmark & others who took away restrictions
@milesSI Were you posting good news of the reduction in cases and hospitalisations and spreading the word…?

@iplumb1983 cases started rising on a day of the week by week basis last Wednesday, Ian. Have been the same way each reported period since. 
No scare tactics, just facts.
@milesSI well was bed ridden for 2 days and have lost feeling when eating n still got it but feeling little better and thanks.
@krisc334 being jabbed doesn't stop you from getting it. Hopefully makes the symptoms less bad. Wishing you a full and speedy recovery.
